reviews.review_msg: If you are taking this class, take it with Camilla Sears. She is very clear, thorough, understanding, helpful and super positive. All of her notes are organized in the same way each class and she fully explains each section before she moves on, stopping for question in between. Not only is she a wonderful prof, she's a great person as well.

Very nice prof and easy to approach about any questions or concerns. Her exams are easy, but watch out for her essay question which can be hard. She is very picky about written assignments,so make sure you write clearly with no spelling mistakes. I had Jeff as my TA and he was awsome, made the class fun and he loves to kid around, but he is serious

She was my Crim 104 professor at my first semester at SFU, it was honestly my favorite class in the whole semester. She's the sweetest professor I've ever met, so helpful, and she's always smiling. My tutorial was right after the lecture so she was my TA as well and she made the tutorial FUN. I definitely want another class with her as my professor
To say it simply, this course was amazing for me mainly because Camilla was teaching it. If you put in the work, very easily, you will get a good grade.

This is my first year and my first semester in SFU. Comparing with other professors, she's among the best I've ever had. She looks after each individual's needs and she's like a sunshine. DEFINITELY TAKE NEXT COURSE WITH HER!!! Even TA was so great during the tutorial session!!! WILL NEVER FORGET THIS COURSE!!! SUCH A MEMORABLE MOMENT FOR ME!!!!!

I absolutely LOVE her. She's really nice, very very helpful, and seems to know everything when questions are asked. The course is fairly easy because the prof's lectures are extremely helpful. I would love to take another class with her. Best prof I've had so far.

I have had her for both criminology 213 and criminology 101.  She's an amazing prof, extremely organized, nice, approachable and clear.  It's not that the material itself is easy (it's university), her teaching style just makes it easy!

Camilla is a great teacher. she is super cute and tries hard to ensure that everyone gets the material.the exams are totally easy(our class average was 80%);i only used the text wen she made references to certain pages that were important;TA Annmarie is great- very helpful.the assignment n paper were easy (mostly opinion based).

Camilla is a very friendly professor. Lecture materials are fun and interesting. This course is good because it encourages you to think about the issues rather than memorizing. The assignments are all all right.  This is one of the best CRIM classes I took at SFU.
awsome teacher, EXTREMELY nice..exams were really easy. Assignments were not that easy but they were do-able.. Overall, great class and and even better teacher!
She was so approachable, and so cute, just the way she'd say stuff, i really enjoyed her class. Exams were fair.

One of the best profs I've had thusfar.  Extremely helpful and seems to actually CARE about her students (which is a nice change!!!)  Would take future courses with Camilla - even if it were Advanced Techniques in Computer Programming!!!

Camilla is the sweetest prof I have ever had! I take her courses just because she is the one teaching them!! She is very knowledgable about the subject matter and you can tell it interests her! She marks fairly and tries to engage all the students to get interested into the material! And she is very helpful in office hours!! She is fabulous!

Great class, so much fun! Hard assignments, but Camilla is more than willing to help and guide. Make sure you take at least one class with Camilla as a prof before you graduate!!! She's the gem of the Crim department!
Camilla is great, she's such a sweetheart. She's well organized and very helpful. Show up to class, copy the notes and some more and you'll ace the class.
Awesome, VERY nice, very helpful, fair tests, very very approachable. Clear, interested and interesting.

Loves what she teaches and tries to make it as interesting as possible. Very organized and comprehensive lectures/notes. Marks very fairly. Term paper is kind of a killer (20-25 pages) but no exams. Overall, she's a lovely person and a very good prof.

The only reason I took this class was because she was teaching it. I absolutely LOVE her teaching style (notes & lectures are very clear & organised) & her tests are fair (no suprises). You can tell she loves what she teaches. By far the best teacher I've taken at SFU! Take any of her classes and you'll see what I mean.

She was a darling, but she just barely kept the reins on the class! She did try to make it as interesting as was possible and she chose good courseware material. If you don't study and take notes (GO TO THE LECTURES...FOR YOUR OWN GOOD) you can fail!
professor sears was so sweet and nice! i would definitely take another crim course or whtever course if she teaches it =)

She is a sweetheart, a little ditsy but sweet. Her tests are very fair. Basically, just go to class, take good notes and study them and you'll be more than fine. Jennifer Chapman is also an awesome TA.

Camilla is a great prof. She is very accomadating to her students. All her lectures are recorded and the overheads are all online which is very helpful! Her classes are easy to follow, not boring. Exams are fair. Not super easy, but not rediculously hard either, they're fair. I would definitely recommend her. I would take another one of her courses

Easy course, nice teacher. Camillia seems like a really kind person. Just show up to class, copy the notes and study from that and you're good. 2 hour classes are boring sometimes, but for easy marks it's definetly a course to take.
Shes really cute but she has no control over the class. Also shes way to quiet. Shes really nice though and really helpful. I think i would like her as a person but shes not the greatest teacher

(ahhh, camilla. you've won my heart!) lectures were well organized, provided with webCT notes and digitally audio recorded. camilla was available always for clarifying whatever it is you need and for help. i'd definitely take another course taught by her.

She's very helpful and nice, athlough her lecture is a bit boring. Midterm was fair but my ta was very hard on it. Everything's clear and concise. Guys, focus on her lecture materials, that's my little suggestion, good luck.
SHES SUCH A SWEETHEART! id love to have her again!!
Are you people deaf and blind?
Shes soooooo nice!
Great teacher, VERY helpful! Yea she tends to be nervous but she's very nice. Midterm and final is the same style. Great exams! Average was 73% for the midterm
No Comments
Very straightforward teaching style

Camilla is a great prof who is very organized with her notes so you know exactly whats gona be on the exams..nothing out of the blue. I really like her teaching style, its very clear and concise! Her exams are fair, not too easy or too hard. Shes veryy nice and sweet! I would definietly take another course with her!!
The reason it's unoriginal is because she's nervous! Easily one of the most organized and easy to understand classes. Seems like a really nice person and very approachable.
boring, unoriginal, puts me to sleep most of the time, and teaches out of the textbook, which makes it questionable to attend lecture. She is nice and happy though.

Amazingly uninteresting. She seems an incredibly nice person, but is the most boring of my professors yet. She cannot hold my attention or the attention of anyone I know, and her high pitched voice almost drove me up the wall. However, she is willing to help.
Super approachable, helpful, clear, organized, and most of all SO FUN! It would be a mistake to leave SFU without taking a course with her first. The gem of the criminology department :)
